page.title: 05HOUSING AND VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: The increased accessability by road today has had two main effects. House property has increased greatly in value, often beyond the means of local people to rent or buy, and is sold largly to developers or "newcomers" who work at a distance. The growth of buit-up arears, New Towns etc. have forced up the price of good agriculturial land from its 1946 price of Â£100 an acre in Hampshire to between Â£1,800 and Â£2,500. The new generation of villagers must now find work in nearby towns, and small village schools have closed and must send their children elsewhere by bus. These changes have also brought great improvements in sanitation and living conditions to country people and far wider opportunitiefor sport, education and social life.
